title: How to Do the Horse Stance in Kung Fu

steps.title: Stand up straight then put your legs apart making sure that your feet are facing forward.
steps.content: Stand up straight then put your legs apart making sure that your feet are facing forward.

steps.title: Be aware of your torso, make sure that your spine is straight and your posture is flat.
steps.content: Be aware of your torso, make sure that your spine is straight and your posture is flat. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Bend your knees and lower the upper body as if you were sitting on horseback.
steps.content: Bend your knees and lower the upper body as if you were sitting on horseback. The lowness of the stance varies in Kung Fu styles, mainly northern and southern: northern is a more relaxed higher stance whereas southern is right down near the ground. Be aware not to put your knees forward or outward over the toes. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Make sure your feet are still facing forward,your body is still straight and your hips are loose.
steps.content: Make sure your feet are still facing forward,your body is still straight and your hips are loose. [3] X Research source

steps.title: To train yourself further with using this stance, first find a stick, assume the horse stance and then place the stick on top of your knees.
steps.content: To train yourself further with using this stance, first find a stick, assume the horse stance and then place the stick on top of your knees.

steps.title: Hold your arms outward, palms parallel to your body.
steps.content: Hold your arms outward, palms parallel to your body.

steps.title: Be mindful of your posture and don't let the stick fall.
steps.content: Be mindful of your posture and don't let the stick fall.
